text: SHOT ON “VIDEO:

PAUL, 28, looking perfect in a worn t-shirt, and ROB, boyishly handsome and funny - both talk TO THE CAMERA as they stroll down Bruin Walk. The guys are clearly familiar with one another, and having a good time. They stop in front of SPROUL HALL.
Here's where we first met Toby.
It was like the second day of college, and we were late for Continental Drift and Sea Floor spreading -- and then we see this hot girl race up the steps in front of us, and Rob shoots me this look -
I didn’t know Paul was gay yet-
TI didn’t know I was gay yet.
Are you gay?
(both charming and earnest) It‘s a little unclear.

Anyway, we followed her into her Dante class - and blew off Sea Floor Spreading - and then I got myself partnered with her to do a oral presentation for a class I wasn’t in. And - we’ve all been friends ever since.
After she rebuffed your persistent and awkward advances.
Naturally.
CATTER, 27, cute with a voice that carries. She taiks to the camera, as well.  2/3/03 2.

Toby lived here ~ and I lived here - She points to Two DOORS directly across one another. CATTER (CONT’D) My roommate was constantly making this foul smelling bean soup in a crock pot under her desk ~- so I Started spending More time in Toby’s room. And we just became really close.
MOLLIE, 28, pretty and a little conservative, picks her way around beer cans, pieces of clothing, etc. There is Clearly a stench.

Toby and I first met here, 1 had just Started dating Rob. I was still on the fence about him because he kept impersonating Christopher Walken when he couldnt think of stuff to Say - but Toby assured me that he was a good guy.
A PHOTO. Five tan, smiling college kids, in a boat, docked on a lake. Paul, Rob, Catter, Mollie and TOBY, 21 in the photo - a cute, slim brunette.
By the time we all went to my folks’ lake house, senior year, we were all pretty close - .
Very close. There is a naked, post- skinny dipping version of this Photo which has been omitted.
But then - THE CHEESY, OMINOUS “DUHN, DUHN, DUHN” CHORDS - PAUL {CONT’D) Toby went to journalism grad school.
Here at USC. The enemy. Where she met Wes. Also the eremy.
We hated that guy.
That guy was a dick.
Yeah, no one liked that guy.
Paul and Rob sit on the steps in front of a cute duplex on an LA street. ™ . PAUL I guess we kind of hated him because Toby started spending all kinds of time with him.
And we were jealous of his clothes.
He has good clothes.
But when they moved in here together, we all just started inserting ourselves into all of their plans -

head_text.subj: WES, TOBY, PAUL, ROB, MOLLIE AND CATTER

text: MAKING PANCAKES IN WES AND TOBY‘S KITCHEN.

head_text.subj: THE GANG HAVING A BBQ IN BACK -
THE GANG ALL SQUASHED ON WES AND TOBY'S FUTON, WATCHING A

text: And then, he really became one of us when 4 we all went back to the lake -  1/9/03 4.

head_text.subj: PHOTO OF THE OLD GANG, PLUS WES, IN THE BOAT AT THE DOCK

text: OF PAUL’S LAKE HOUSE. . :
And Wes came, too.
Rob and Paul are still on the front steps. Rob pulls out a magazine.

Of course, now they’re big shots. Rob holds up a copy of NOISE, a glossy men’s magazine, and then flips to an advice column inside: “DON’T F*CK IT UP’. The byline reads: WRITTEN BY TOBY PULLMAN AND WES BROWN. And there is a PHOTO of the two of them above the column, Toby smiling, Wes’ middle finger blurred out as he flips off the camera.
Giving questionably helpful - but certainly entertaining - relationship advice to the lovesick and twisted of our great nation.
Their relationship is amazing. I've never had a boyfriend who's lasted more than five months - including a protracted two week break up process - and they Manage to love together, and work together -
Yeah. Working together. Amazing. Once, right after we got engaged, Rob and I tried to move a sofa together. We couldn‘t even do that.  ‘1/9/93 CLOSE ON SANDRA, 58, TOBY’S MOM AND JIM, 62, TOBY'S DAD:
The first time Toby brought him over to the house, they sat on the living room floor with me and helped me organize 4 scrapbook. He was just -- in-
As Toby’s dad, I guess I should welcome Wes to the family, but he’s already a part of it. I hope he knows that.
paul and Rob are still seated on the front steps. Paul is uncorking a pottie of merlot, and hastily pouring two glasses, handing one to Rob.
So, here’s to Wes and Toby.

head_text.subj: WES AND TOBY IN A POOL, HE'S TRYING TO LIFT HER IN A LAME
-WES AND TOBY IN THEIR, GRADUATION CAPS AND GOWNS --
A PUBLICITY STILL FROM THEIR MAGAZINE COLUMN --
HALLOWEEN, AS ADAM BND EVE IN FLESH COLORED BODYSUITS --
HARD AT WORK IN THEIR OFFICE AT NOISE --

text: Rob and Paul lift their glasses.
You guys are an inspiration te us all. As the image of Rob FREEZES and flickers, we

A beautiful night on the patio in the Hollywood restaurant. Wes and Toby's rehearsal dinner is in full swing.  —_— 1/9/03 6. ROB AND PAUL, now dressed in suits, flank a huge video Screen, where Rob's image still flickers. Applause rolls in from the few tables surrounding them. We realize we've been watching Paul and Kob’s “video speech” . Paul steps forward.

So, again - to Wes and Toby, And to their last night of singlehcod. Paul lifts a glass of Champagne. We scan the rest of the crowd as they do the same. We see WES AND TOBY,- surrounded by all their friends and family. CATTER to Wes’ right, and MOLLIE to her xight. Toby's parents JIM AND SANDRA to her left and her brother KIP, 30 and odd, to their left. Everyone could not seem happier. As everyone downs their champagne, Wes leans over and kisses Toby on the forehead. She puts her head on his shoulder.

Wes and Toby Say the last of their good-byes to everyone. Wes walks toward the car as Toby finishes hugging Catter and Mollie. Toby jogs to catch up with Wes. They walk to the car - Wes takes her hand. He unlocks the doors and they both get in.

Wes and Toby drive down Beverly Blvd. toward their apartment. Wes tries to change some CDs while driving, causing him to stop and start inappropriately, mixed in with some swerving. Toby is used to this, she seems unfazed.

Wes’ old BMW pulls up and stops at the Pumps. He gets out, and as we follow him around the front of the car, we land on Toby's face, staring forward. As out of focus Wes goes about his business in the background, Toby's face visibly alters. We can literally see her thinking. Her mouth tightens, her pupils dilate, and, finally, her eyes well up. Wes comes back around the front of the car and gets in. Before he starts the car -
(quietly) I can‘t do this.
Hmmm?
Tomorrow -
We’re getting married.
I can’t. Wes takes this in:
Are you busy?
I love you but I can’t marry you.
You‘re just freaking out.
I know. But I've been freaking out for 3 months and I thought it would go away but 4 it hasn’t. You don’t want me to marry you if I have doubts, do you? Wes considers this.
Yes. I do. You have doubts when you erder McNuggets instead of a cheeseburger. I think we’ll be OK.
.No. We won’t, This is different. Wes looks at her for a good, long time.
Get out.
Wes -
iI7m serious. Be reaches over her and opens the door. She starts to get out.  “1/9/03 . 8.
Wes, you tried this on me when we had that fight at the Beverly Center about that suit.
That suit was hot. Really.
Yes.
Are we getting married tomorrow? Wes looks at Toby for an answer. She looks back at him, wishing she had one, but says nothing.

OK. Shut the door, “Toby looks him in the eye. He doesn’t flinch, she shuts the door. Wes pulls away. Toby stands and watches as his taillights fade into the distance. She watches him drive, expecting to see him turn around. He just keeps driving. She waits some more. And more. It starts to sink in - he's not coming back,
“ _ aAcT 1

as it goes off - 6am on the nose. INT. WES’ (& TOBY'S) APARTMENT - MORNING We reveal Wes, wide awake, still laying in bed. He gets up, doesn’t even bother shatting off the alarm, and heads out of the bedroom. The sound of the beeping alarm DISSOLVES INTO:

The sound of a HUGE TRUCK BACKING UP, startling Toby awake. She is asleep on the couch of what is obviously her office, still in her dress from the rehearsal dinner. She groggily gets up, makes her way to her desk and signs on to her COMPUTER.

INT. WES’ (& TOBY’S) APARTMENT - SAME 4 Wes, now in his home office - sitting down at his computer doing the same thing. As we cut close on beth ¢ puter screens, we see Wes and Toby open the same email - titled ARTICLE 433 LETTER. As they both open the emailed letter, we begin to hear it in Vo: MAN’S VOICE (V.0.) Dear Wes and Toby: I’m a guy, I’m 28, and I’m in love with a beautiful, kind, wonderful woman.

head_text.subj: WOMAN HAVING SEX WITH ALL SORTS OF DIFFERENT MEN

text: —_— 1/9/03 10. Nn MAN’S VOICE (V.0.) She's also a cali girl. My cail girl. I’ve been seeing her for the last five years.

head_text.subj: THE SAME WOMAN HAVING SEX ALL

text: Here’s the thing - I don’t know how to make the switch. I want to marry this woman, but to her I'm just another . customer. I need you to help me share my heartfelt feelings with my high class hooker. Signed, John.

head_text.subj: " FREEZE FRAME OF THIS MAN, AS HE PLACES AN ENVELOPE

text: With the almost exact opposite look on his face. He stands, in his version of golf attire (shorts and a t- shirt), near the club house, bag of clubs on his back. He looks to the first tee and sees the group of guys gathered - Paul, Rob, Jim, Kip, and a few others. He steels himself and makes his way over. As he gets closer he sees what awaits him - Paul’s mixing drinks on the golf cart and everyone’s wearing “Toby and Wes 2003" golf hats. They all turn and greet Wes enthusiastically as he approaches.
Wesley James Brown. Welcome. Paul quickly shoves a drink in Wes’ hand.

We're next on the tee so drink up. Wes looks at the drink, shrugs and then downs it in a matter of seconds. They all start to make their way up to the tee box. Rob walks next to Wes and puts his arm around him.
So how you feeling? Are you nervous?

Nervous? Not really nervous. Jim walks up beside them. JIM . What has he got to be nervous about? ‘ WES . Exactly, Mr. Pullman. Exactly my point. Wes presses on to the tee box with the rest of the group. He looks around at everyone. Just locking at them, saying nothing. He's starting to freak them out. WES (CONT'D) . Well, before we start, I'd like to just Say a few words.

Go on you big sap. Wes takes a breath and smiles. WES. There'll be no wedding today. or at all. Toby has called it off. Should I do the honors? With that, Wes puts his tee.in the ground with his ball on top of it, grabs his club, and takes a full swing at the ball - making great contact. No one can believe what he just said. Wes watches the ball fly - straight as an arrow.
That’11 work. Wes picks up his bag and starts walking down the fairway leaving all of the guys in stunned silence. INT. ESTILO SALON - Day

She sits in a salon chair, her hair in an elaborate updo, her makeup impeccable. ROAN, the hairdresser, is setting a beaded hairband, with veil attached, into her hair. Catter, Mollie and Sandra stand around her, beaming, as the veil gets attached.  1/9/03 . : 12.
You look perfect.
I don’t know. I feel like the hairband is a little high. She YANKS on it, a little violently. Roan stops her and ‘ adjusts it himself.
You don't think it looks a little high? |
I think it looks pretty perfect. Sandra looks at Toby, in her veil, and starts to cry.
Mom, please don’t cry. Seriously -- it's not necessary.
Toby, I’m gonna cry. I only get to see my daughter get ready for her wedding once in my lifetime. Toby takes a look at herself in the mirror.
(softly) Possibly twice. Everyone looks at Toby. Uncomfortable silence envelops everyone, including Roan.
(trying to be calm)
Toby takes a long, slow exhale.
T'm not getting married today. Catter starts to hyperventilate and walk around in circles.
What is she saying? Mollie, ask her what she’s saying. WHAT ARE YOU SAYING?  1/9/03 13.
Toby, sweetie, wnat are you saying? Toby looks at them for a moment, and then begins. Her tone leaves little doubt.

I’m calling it off. I just - 1 realized that it just didn’t feel right, and that Wes has taken such good care of me, but I think - I mean I know - what I really need to do is take care of myself. To see what is me. when it’s just me. So, I just can’t do it. Stunned silence still fills the room. Toby tugs violently on the hairband again.
I don’t know, I still think this thing is a little high. Toby continues to re-adjust the hairband, as Roan and the ladies look at her in stunned silence.
The guys are all in the middle of the fairway. Rob's CEL “PHONE RINGS. He grabs it.
(into phone) Hey.
Mollie stands outside on her cel phone, in a panic.
{into phone) What the hell? Rob sneakily tries to walk away from the guys.
I know.
So he told you?
And they can just do that? -
Apparently.
I don’t like it and I’11 tell you why. It devalues engagement. It devalues our engagement. No one said you could un- engage.
Mollie - please. I think there are other things to worry about now. Mollie thinks about this-
You're right. How’s he doing? Rob looks back and sees Wes, in the sandtrap, taking . mltiple swings at a ball. He’s making no contact at all. There’s just sand flying around him.
He’s about 250 over par right now.
He’s going to act like everything’s fine.
Yep.
It’s not.

I know. Rob’s still looking at Wes, who finally gets the ball oxt of the trap. It’s a high arching, beautiful shot. Wes throws his arms in the air in victory. INT. JIM & SANDRA’S HOUSE - AFTERNOON A big, comfortable, cluttered house in Hancock Park. Which is now filled with wedding favors and catering trays and flowers. , Jim, Sandra, Kip and Toby sit at the dining room table. Sandra, in sweatpants, cradles the phone with her shoulder as she pours herself some wine.  1/9/03 . 15. ° SANDRA No. Yeah. Whole thing. We May as well still do the brunch tomorrow. That's my other line again. 1'11 call you back. The family just watches in silence as Sandra works the Phone.

Hello. Oh yeah, is that right? I don’t know, we'll look into that later. Yeah, Toby’s here. We're going to have a little dinner.. Sandra hangs up. SANDRA (CONT‘D) Toby, that was your grandmother. she wanted us all to know that she would have been leaving right now for the first wedding of a grandchild, but instead she's watching Access Hollywood. And she doesn’t think she'll be able to return the girdle that she bought special for this day because it was on sale.
Maybe I should just go -
Where are you going to go? You are not sleeping at that office again. You are staying here with us until you find a new place.
What? After grad school, I wanted to move back in and live here forever, and you guys wouldn't let me.
We wanted you to have your own place so you'd have some shot at finding a relationship.
Toby got her own place - and look what happened there. Jim sees the conversation going south, and tries to save it.  1/9/03 16. . JvIM So, who’s hungry? Sandra gets up and peruses the catering trays.
Well, we've got 128 stuffed chicken breasts, and 162 beef filets. Who wants what?

I think I’11 just make myself a sandwich later. Toby stays seated at the table as her family helps themselves to outrageous portions of beef and chicken. They all sit back down and start to eat, silently, until Kip comes up for a breath.

This is crazy. How are you going to do this? Don’t you guys have a contract at the magazine? Together? How do you - expect to see each other every day after this? . Silence. Toby has no idea what to say. Finally, the PHONE RINGS and Sandra grabs it.

{into phone) Hello. Yes, the only thing we couldn’t cancel was the food because they already started the prep work. No - I think we got everything - the hand, the bartenders, most of the flowers - As Sandra rattles off all of the things that didn’t happen today, we close in on Toby, definitely unsettled. INT. WES’ (& TOBY’S) APARTMENT - LATER Wes sits in front of the Tv, ostensibly watching M2, but it is clear his mind is elsewhere. His and Toby's fat cat SLIM sits on the back of the couch behind him. And then there is a KNOCK. Wes goes to the door. ARK, 27, a large Russian man in a black blazer stands there, expectantly.
Heilo. I am Ark. I'ma little late.  1/9/03 : 17. Wes clearly has no idea who this man is.
Ark, I am so pissed off about that.

Sorry. The dispatcher tells 8364 not 8346. ‘Wes looks out to the street, and sees a stretch LIMO. Wes looks at the limo, and back to Ark. WES ‘ Let me ask you something, Ark. You‘ve already been paid for tonight?
Of course. The parents of the bride arranged weeks ago. A small smile starts to grow on Wes‘ face.

A mid-century, cool, Beachwood Canyon pad. Paul sits at the long kitchen table with Catter, Rob and Mollie. Several other people mill about which gives us the feeling (rightly so) that there is often a Party of some kind going here. Paul wears his telephone headset and takes calls as the groups chats.
What about the Holiday Pot Luck Secret Santa Party? And the lake - what about going back to the lake this summer?
What about every weekend for the rest of our lives?
Maybe we just cali them both and let them figure out who comes to what.
I’m picking Toby.
We have to pick together.
Then you’re picking Toby, too. The phone RINGS.
{into phone) Yeah. Brunch is still on at the Pullmans. Yeah, come on over if you want.
Wes was jilted. I should pick Wes.
You're like Toby's best friend.
I still think I should take him. Paul shoots Cdtter a scolding look.
{serious} Catter, you're not taking Wes.
{to Paul) Then you take him.
I don’t want him.
I think we should take him. The phone RINGS again. |
(into phone) No. No problem. The hotel should still give you the rate. Yeah, absolutely come by.
Seriously, you guys, what do we do about birthdays? Or when one of them starts to date someone.
What about our wedding? I don’t want either of them.  ¢ _ 1/9/03 19.
What? .

They got dis-engaged. I don’t want that kind of cautionary tale lurking around my wedding. dust as Mollie is finishing her thought, they all look up. And fall silent. Toby is standing there. It’s awkward. They're not sure how much she heard.

Hey. I just - I saw the lights on and some people inside so I just - Paul hops up and tackles Toby in a hug. He just keeps hugging her, smashing her face into his chest. TOBY (CONT’D) {a little muffled) Are you guys pissed?
Yes.
Seriously?
Yes.
For real?
Yes.
I’m sorry. Paul keeps hugging her.
The limo is parked. Ark sits in front, staring out the windshield. Wes opens the door and gets in the back.
Thanks for making the stop, Ark. Wes reaches into the front seat and hands Ark a white bag. .  1/9/03 20. WES (CONT’D) I got you a double double.
Thank you.
No problem. Wee and Ark both start to eat their double doubles, as Ark pulls out onto Sunset.
I take it, we are not arriving at the wedding. ‘ .
No, Ark. We will not be arriving there. That is fine.
Is it?
Is it not?
What?
I.do not understand.

She told me last right that she couldn’t go through with it. It’s crazy, I'm supposed to rethink my entire life in like twelve hours. Everything that I thought was -- isn’t. Ark ia listening and nodding with deep sympathy.
Yes, man, Wes. I understand. I know what you need. He looks at Wes with a deep, abiding knowledge.

INT. CHEETAH’S - NIGHT Wes and Ark both slam a SHOT with a beer chaser as. STRIPPERS gyrate behind them. Ark looks to be holding his liquor well, Wes is swervy and loaded. . Ark points to one of the strippers.
That is Angie. Nice girl. Her little girl is spelling champion. Give her ten dollars. . Wes does as he’s told.

(to Angie) You're doing a fabulous job. Ark hands Wes another shot. He slams it, and tucks some more money in Angie’s g-string. WES (CONT’D) (to Angie) So, Angie, do any of the ladies here do a little hocking on the side? Angie shoots an ANGRY LOOK at Ark.
I am sorry Angie. His wedding did not arrive today and he is drunk. Perhaps we go.

No, not for me. Not for me, hookers. For my article. This guy wants to marry his hooker, and I thought I could ask her the hooker perspective. Ark starts to lift Wes out of his seat. Ark tucks some more money into Angie’s g-string.
Tell Diane good luck for spelling hee. Ark helps a very drunk Wes to the door.

A FULL HOUSE PARTY has developed. Paul, wearing an apron with the TORSO OF A NAKED MAN printed on it, serves drinks and manages the party like a pro.  1/9/03 . 22. THE CAMERA follows Paul as he weaves through the crowd, until he stops at CATTER. She smiles.as he hands her a drink. Paul is like magical - he always has a drink to give.
You know I was going to take two Ativan to get through their wedding. That‘s what it takes now - two pills per wedding.
Why? Weddings are a bold statement of hope in our crazy world. With booze. Paul downs his drink happily.
I feel compelled to start the count-back at every wedding.
The what?

The count back. See, if you work backwards, even if I met my future husband in the next fifteen seconds, we'd still have to date a year - minimum - before a proposal, probably eighteen months. - and then a year engagement - 80 the very soonest I could be walking down the aisle is two and half years from now. And that’s if the guy is standing in your kitchen. It's pathetic. Catter downs her drink.
So, you should be happy that Wes and Toby called it off. Two more miserable single people like you.
No - see that’s the thing. That depresses me, too.
How is that possible?
Because it goes to show how unjust it all ig. (MOR2)

There are girls like Toby who get great guys and toss them back, and then there are girls like me who only seem to date guys who play bass and live at home and fear commitment. PAUL. Guess you're screwed. Paul smiles at Catter, kisses her on the head, and moves off to continue hosting. Catter stands there, alone. She walks to a tiny alcove near the kitchen and pulls out her CEL PHONE. She scrolls through until she lands on the name TOBY/WES. She hits SEND. She waits as the Phone rings. And rings. Finally - the machine Picks up. It’s Wes’ voice.

Hey ~ we're not here - leave a message. Catter hangs up. She stands for a second. She then walks to the kitchen - and as she passes them we stop: WITH ROB AND MOLLIE - Both seriously explaining something to Paul. Paul nods along in between sips of his drink.
So, we're kind of screwed. Most people - they buy china, pots, towels, They work from the registry.
We got creative,
First mistake. I don’t think you can return scuba lessons.
That’s like returning fruit. Paul considers their problem.
So you can't return it, Let's take this So-called negative and spruce it up. Are either of you schooled in the art of scuba? Rob and Mollie shake their heads no.

There you go.  1/9/03 24. With that, Paul leaves - and the camera follows him as he walks toward - . TOBY - who sits on the kitchen counter, alone, taking it all in. As Paul walks by her, he hands her a drink.

Drink up momma. He continues on, but we stay with Toby. She takes a huge sip of her drink. As she brings it down, she notices her hand. Actually, she notices her. ENGAGEMENT RING, which ghe’s still wearing. She plays with it for a second, . spinning it around, before surreptitiously taking it off and putting it in her pocket. EXT. PAUL’S HOUSE - SAME The limo pulls slowly up to the curb in front of Paul's.

Wes now sits in the front seat with Ark. He is drinking directly out of a bottle of Kettle One, and he is. loaded They both gaze inside at the party through Paul’s front window - the sounds of MUSIC and LAUGHING carrying. from the party into the open limo window. WES . . That used to be my life in there that I’m not invited to. Ark isn't sure how to respond.

I gotta piss. With that, Wes gets out of the limo. EXT. PAUL‘S HOUSE - SAME Wes makes his way up onto Paul’s lawn, vodka in hand. He finds a tree to shield him from the street, and PES. And PEES. And PEES. It seems to go on forever.
ROB looks out the window, and sees something. It’s WES. He tells Mollie. Word starts to spread.

EXT.’ PAUL’S HOUSE - SAME Wes is still peeing, but now a CROWD of people has started to form on Paul’s stoop. Wes finally finishes. And looks up. He is caught. He looks down at the vodka bottle in his hand and - in a moment of drunken genius - lifts the bottle in the air.

i came by - to make a toast. I worked hard on this toast and it probably won’t be applicable in a lot of other . situations, and I didn’t want to waste a good toast. So - here goes. I hope you'll indulge me. . Wes takes another slug of vodka. Wes pulls a slip of paper from his pocket and begins to read it to the crowd.

Here's to all of you, my dearest friends, who have traveled from every corner of the globe to be here tonight. I hope you're all having a wonderful time, because I’ve certainly had a wonderful time having each of you in my life. Paul, Rob, Mollie and Catter all exchange concerned looks. Wes presses on. WES (CONT’D) And, of course, let’s all raise our glasses to my beautiful bride-NOT-to-be -- I don't know what I would do without you. The crowd is PERFECTLY SILENT. Even Wes seems a little surprised by what has just come out of his mouth. He - finally - feels a little awkward. WES (CONT‘D) So - ummm - have a great time. I hope everyone really is - happy. Goodnight. Just as Wes is about to turn and walk back to the limo, HE AND TOBY MEET EYES. She is standing, one small girl in the big crowd, looking at him. He lets his eyes linger on her, and then ,turns away and gets into the limo. The crowd starts to disperse, but Toby stays on the porch, watching the limo fade into the distance. FADE OUT.

INT. NOISE OFFICES - WES & TOBY’S OFFICE - DAY Wes sits at his desk, at a loss, as he watches JUDY, 22, sitting across from him, her face buried in her hands. Wes comes around the desk and sits next to her. He hands her a glass of water.
It's OK. It’s going to be OK. Take a little sip of water. Judy slowly lifts her face, and takes a sip of water. She looks at Wes. Her face is blotchy from crying.
I don’t understand. You guys are so great together.
I gotta be honest, Judy, I don’t quite understand either.
Now what's going to happen? Are you still gonna work together? Am I still going to be an assistant to both of you? Am I going to have to pick one of you over the other? Am I fired?
Well, we have a lot of things to figure out.
This is not right. I've always aspired to have what you guys have - both personally and professionally. And it was all a lie.
I don’t know if it was a lie exactly -

dudy begins to cry again, and her face goes back into her hands. Wes just sits there, completely helpless.  1/9/03 27. INT.’ NOISE OFFICES - LOBBY - SAME The elevator doors open. Toby, looking a little tired, steps off the elevator and warily makes her way down the hall. Out of the corner of her eye she spots VIRGINIA KEMP, 40's, very skinny and passive/aggressive. Toby speeds “up, but Virginia is quickly in step with her.
(bitchy) You're in kinda late. .
I had a - kinda - rough weekend.
(false compassion) Oooh. Yeah. I heard about that. Is everything OK with that?
It happened the day before yesterday, Virginia.
Yeah. That’s rough.
Yes. It is.
Rough stuff.
Yes, Toby stops walking, and looks Virginia in the eye, TOBY (CONT’D) You don't really care about how this is affecting me emotionally, do you?
Not a lot.
You're concerned how the writing team you hired is going to continue producing for you.
It has crossed my mind.
Can you give us'a little time to feel: ' things out?
Yes.
Cool. Thank you. Toby starts toward her office.
We have lunch with the owner of this magazine at 12:30. That gives you over three hours.
Perfect.

Listen, Toby. ' You are the brains of that Operation. I’ve always known that. 1 trust that you will figure this out. Toby is not sure whether to be flattered or frightened as she turns and walks toward her office. INT. NOISE MAGAZINE - TOBY AND WES’ OFFICE - SAME Toby enters the office just as Judy ig leaving. Judy stops, grabs Toby in a big hug.
I still love-you both. Judy leaves. Toby slowly enters.’ “TOBY Hey kid. Wes doesn’t look up.
Hey. Silence. Toby walke over to her desk (their desks face each other) and sits down.  1/9/03 29.
So. Nice showing with the .apeech the other night. .
Yeah. I really felt like I nailed it. Toby laughs.
That’s funny. She laughs a little more. TOBY (CONT’D) Funny.
It wasn’t that funny.
Wes, I was just trying to -
Don’t. He gets up and hands her some papers.
Here's my pass at the hooker advice letter. Look at it when you can. Toby takes it, seems a little surprised.
Wes, you know, I'm really glad to see you. I wasn’t sure you’d come in today, or ever, and I know we need to -
I'm going to get some coffee.
You don’t drink coffee.
I know. Wes averts Toby's eyes as he exits the office. She sits there for a second, stung. Then she turns to the papers and starts to read:  1/3/03 30.

Dear John, Here’s something I’ve learned quite recently: girls suck. You meet a girl who seems normal - she has a real job and she seems totally acceptable to your friends and family and everything - and then she turns out to be a freak. A total nutcase. Toby's not sure how to take this. WES (CONT'D) . So I think you're on to something here. A prostitute. Why not? She’il never cheat on you, except for having sex with hundreds of guys. And I'm sure she’ll never leave you. I think it’s a solid plan. Toby spins her chair around to her computer, and starts to type. As she types, we hear her voice over and we go
John, the writer of our letter, strides down the hali, reading from a copy of NOISE MAGAZINE that he holds in ene hand. He holds a bouquet of flowers in the other.
This may be hard to believe, John, but I agree with Wes’ advice, if not the sentiment. You really have nothing to lose. FULL SCREEN AS: John slips his KEY CARD into a door.
If you come clean about your feelings, at worst, you'll spend a couple of weekends “comparison shopping” for a new call girl.
John enters to find MELISSA, early 20’s, a beautiful and voluptuous woman in a revealing teddy, lounging on the bed, eating candy from the mini-bar.
And at best, you’1ll have found yourself a new girlfriend who puts out.  1/9/03 31. John sits down on the bed next to Melissa.
You look fantastic.
Thanks, baby. He sits, holding the flowers, just staring at her. She starts to remove his shirt.
I wanted to get something for you - He hands her the flowers. She takes them, and puts them on the bedside table.
You didn’t have to do that. You already bought me a Grey Goose and a Toblerone from the mini bar. She shows him the empty mini-vodka bottle and candy wrapper, with a sly smile.
You are so cute.
So are you. He looks at her, smiles, and TACKLES her on the bed. They laugh and wrestle, until they are both a little out of breath. Then, John looks at Melissa.
Melissa, I want to ask you something. She unbuckles his belt.
Mmmm- hmm, He steels himself. And he takes the plunge.

I really like you, and you are so beautiful and fun and I - I just want to know if you’d consider being my girlfriend. Melissa stops what she's doing. She pulls back from John, and looks into his eyes.  1/9/03 . 32.
I would love to be your girlfriend, baby.
Yeah? ~ Melissa looks at him, touches his cheek, and smiles.

Yeah. We see John’s expression turn from one of anxiety to one of PURE BLISS as Melissa grabs him and pulls him down on the bed on top of her. INT. PAUL’S HOUSE - DAY Paul and Catter sit on the floor of the living room. The contents of Paul‘s liquor cabinet, which is EXTENSIVE, are spread around them.
Are you sure you are sticking to the system? Catter smiles, a little bit drunk.

Yes, Paul. I know the system. Organize all liquors alphabetically and by brand within categories. And drink anything less than a shot left in any bottle. Paul pounds what is left in a bottle of tequila.
Just making sure, They continue to sort and drink, sort and drink.
{trying to sound nonchalant) So, have you talked to Wes?
Mmm-hmmm .
Is he - you know - how’s he doing?
Do you think maybe I should stop by or make him some - . Paul empties another bottle and looks Catter in the eyes.
Catter - DON'T. I know you've always had a weird thing for him -
I have not!
You told me when you met him, and I quote "I have a weird thing for him.” Gatter’s busted.
That was 6 years ago. We've been friends now for 6 years. I just want to make sure he’s all right.
Please don’t. OK? Catter polishes off a bottle of vodka and doesn't answer.
Toby, Wes, Virginia and LUCIUS THOMSON, 50s, sit at a round table in the middle of the posh, crowded restaurant.
I cannot believe that you two have been writing a column for my magazine for years, and this is the first time we have shared a proper meal together.
Please. You have a gagillion dollar industry to - you know - manage -- or whatever. He laughs.
Listen, I read the column every month, and from what I hear the book deal for your volume of collected articles is coming together very quickly -  Peer 1/3/03 34.
It's true - we hope to have. it out by summer.
‘ But most of all - I like the story behind the story. ‘ Virginia's face goes pale.
Did you read last months advice to that born again virgin? it was - ‘Thomson totally ignores Virginia and barrels on -

I mean, you two are these smart, hip kids, who are totally in love and committed to each other, giving relationship advice - it’s perfect. You are still irreverent and smart-aasy - ‘ which I love - but people also believe’ that they can do it, because you guys are doing it. Wes and Toby sneak a look at each other. WES . Yeah, umm - that’s not all that accurate. SILENCE. Virginia is now fully panicked. She and Toby both look at Wes, just waiting.
Because, in all honesty, Toby’s not that smart. : TOBY . And Wes is unbelievably un-hip. WES . She mostly has to “sound it out" if the word is more than four letters.

He likes the Olive Garden for both the food and the ambience. Thomson laughs as he opens his menu. Both Toby and Virgina seem relieved that Wes has decided to play ball. The WAITER walks by. Wes stops him.  f 1/9/03
Excuse me - how are your stripes prepared?
Ummm -
He means ribs.
Oh, they’re braised.
Thanks. The waiter leaves, Thomson and Virginia are confused,
Wes won't call them ribs.
It’s too - bodily.
So I made up stripes.
It gives some distance between me and the animal. Thomson looks at Wes and Toby with wonder.
You guys are quite a team. Wes and Toby look at each other and force a smile.
Rob and Mollie, in sweatpants, with towels over their shoulders, enter the indoor pool area.
Mollie, I promise. You're overthinking. When we introduce ourselves you're Toby and I'm Wes. That's it. Then we don‘t have to deal with it again.
I don’t know. Were engaged, Rob. I feel like it’s bad luck to pose as a Couple whe didn’t go through with it. 35.  1/9/03 36.
I don’t. I think it's good luck.
What? Why? Rob is trapped. He has no answer.
Listen, maybe we won't even have to lie. I had to tell the woman in the office we were Wes and Toby. But the instructor probably won‘t care who we are.
Yeah?
Yeah. I’m sure they won't know it was a wedding present.
Yeah. Probably not. I have always wanted to scuba.

Exactly. It's going to be fine. Rob and Mollie make their way over to the small group at the far end of the pool. As they get closer, they see that there are TWO WETSUITS remaining, on hangers. On one of them is a BIG BRIDAL VEIL and on the other are a BOW TIE and TAILS. Mollie now GLARES at Rob as MITCH, 30, greets them.
And you must be Wes and Toby, our newlyweds! The class breaks out into spontaneous clapping and cheers as they beam at Rob and Mollie. Mollie is displeased.
Lunches are finished, and Virginia and Thomson listen as Toby is mid-story. Wes taps his fork.
So we get the cat back to our apartment - it’s like eight weeks old - and we hear this crazy ruckus upstairs. (MORE)
We go up there - and there’s a bird - a huge crow - flying around our bedroom. I mean - it was like massive, right? She turns to Wes, who’s sort of out of it.
(recovering) Right. Right. So I put on this -

Windbreaker - and he pulls the hood up so only his eyes are showing. And grabs a tennis racket. . As Toby continues on, we can see Wes’ eyes get further and further away. He’s not even listening anymore. He _ looks around the restaurant - at all the couples eating people laughing. He turns back and looks at Toby as she’s telling the story. She's very animated - gesturing as she talks. And then he notices it. His eyes go wide. IN SLO-MO Toby’s left hand, gesturing, with NO ENGAGEMENT RING ON. She’s taken it off. Wes can‘t believe it. TOBY (CONT’D) - instead of turning on the light he flips the ceiling’ fan switch. So now the bird is going nuts. Wes quickly stands up.
I ummm. Excuse me. Wes abruptly leaves the table.
Wes exits the restaurant and just starts walking. And walking. Either really fast or extremely slow - it’s hard to tell. Then his CEL PHONE RINGS.
Hello.
It's dudy. Where are you? They said you went to the bathroom and never came back.
They’re still waiting for you. And your aunt called. And Catter called for you..
You mean for Toby.
No, for you. A flicker of confusion passes across Wes’ face.

’ Listen, Judy, could you just put me through to Toby? guDY (0.S.) . No problem. Hold on. Judy puts Wes on hold. Hold music comes on. But it’s that Tina Turner song that goes “We don’t need another hero...” It's like nails down a chalkboard. The song gets louder and louder and begins to consume Wes.as he stands on Sunset Blvd. in front of Chin Chin. People continue to walk by as things get blurry - Wes is barely keeping it together, things start to spin. Finally, the song is cut off by: ToBY (0.S.) Wes? Where are you?

I can’t do this, Toby. I quit. Wes looks at the phone in shock, as if the phone itself had just said those words. He then slips his phone into his pocket and - out of sheer inertia - keeps walking. EXT. WES’ (& TOBY’S) APARTMENT - LATER Wes, still dazed, comes walking up to his front door to find - Catter. Sitting on the stoop. She seems - drunk.
Hey.
Uh - hey.
Paul made me help organize his liquor cabinet -
Alphabetize the bottles. Drink up the dregs.
I gave it my all.
You're a good friend. She stands, looking at him. He heads toward the door.
So, I just wanted to come by to see if you were OK. - Wes is unlocking the door. He turns to her.
I don't think so, Not yet. I have to figure some shit out before I'm actually OK.
Right. Catter keeps looking at him. He might cry. Or she might cry. But instead -- CATTER KISSES WES. For a moment, Wes doesn’t resist. And then:
Catter, Jesus, you're the maid of honor. Catter stares at him - beginning to realize what she’s done.
IT think you better go. Wes turns and goes inside, closing the door behind him.
INT. WES’ APARTMENT - LIVING ROOM - MORNING

They are both laughing and drinking from 40 oz. beers. We reveal Wes holding the photo, standing in the middle ‘of his living room. There is a CARDBOARD BOX next to him, filled with various CDS, BOOKS, etc. He takes the picture and expertly tosses it into the box. He looks around, satisfied. Then, he reaches over to the coffee table and grabs what looks like an ELECTRIC RAZOR. . He looks at it, and adjusts something. He then lifts it up to his head and we see ~ it’s not a razor - its a HAIR CLIPPER. Without even looking in the mirror, Wes shaves a clean, stripe through his hair. And then another. He continues shaving his head, hair falling around him on the couch, until he is completely bald. He puts down the razor, feels his newly shorn head, and allows himself a small SMILE. ‘EXT. OFFICE BUILDING + DAY Toby, work bag over her shoulder, slips through the revolving door of the Noise offices, and onto sunny Wilshire Blvd.
Toby walks into the small deli like she owns the place.
Bradley, I’m borrowing your People. Toby reaches behind the register and grabs a People Magazine, as BRADLEY, 40s, comes out of the kitchen.

Hey, Toby. Toby takes a seat and starts to read her People magazine. A CUTE GUY, late 20s, smiles at Toby. She smiles back, and continues reading her People. Bradley arrives with two sodas.  1/9/03 41. BRADLEY (CONT’D) Cream soda for the lady and Arnold Palmer for my main man -
Wes won’t be - ukh - joining me today.

Oh, yeah? Bradley is unfazed. He simply takes Wes’ drink, and starts to drink it himself as he heads back to the kitchen. Toby goes back to reading her People magazine. The cute guy watches her as he eats his sandwich. She notices, and gives him ariother awkward smile.
So, where is he?
Emmm?
The guy - where’s the guy? Toby just looks at him, confused.
That guy you‘re always in here with. I’ve seen you two. I’m Craig. I work at Schwab - sixth floor.
Oh.
So, he's your, what, your business partner?
Ubbhh -
Your boyfriend?
Ummmm -
Your boss? Your grandad? Your pipe fitter? What?  1/9/03 42. Toby smiles.
He's my former fiancee, my recently resigned writing partner and, right now, my smallest fan.
Your smaliest fan?
Opposite of biggest fan. I thought maybe it was smallest fan. Whatever -- he's not a fan. The cute guy smiles.
Well, that makes one of us. Toby looks up, blushing. She is clearly out of practice , with the flirt.
Oh - ummm -

Have a drink with me after work. Just to help you drown your sorrows. Nothing weird. Toby looks at him, sizing him up. CUTE GUY {CONT’D) Listen, I can’t make it weird, because then I‘d have to find a new deli, and I really like the number three no onion, so that’s like a guarantee that it will be unweird. Toby - almost despite herself - smiles, which is as good as "Yes."
A very modern, spare office building in Santa Monica. Wes, with his newly shaved head and a funky tan suit, approaches the security desk. MARTY, a beefy black guy, sits at the desk.
Hi. I’m Wes Brown. I'm here for the Interview - (MORE)
(he points to a blow up of an Interview magazine cover on the wall) - uhh - interview. ° Wes laughs nervously. Marty does not. He just punches some keys on his computer.
They got you up in here as Dave.
Uh, I’m Wes,
They got you up in here as Dave. Wes just shrugs in acceptance.
cur To: " CLOSE ON: A NAMETAG, WITH THE NAME “DAVE”
. We pull back to reveal Wes, wearing his nametag, sittin on a couch in a large, spare office. DANIEL, 40s, sits across from him,
I really think your column is well- written, or I wouldn't even be considering you for the position -
Thanks - ‘

However, I also need to know if you have confidence in your talent as an interviewer as well as a writer. Interviewing requires a whole different skili set than what you are used to using for your column at Noise.
You know, it’s funny, because in grad school that’s what Toby and I wanted to do. (MORE)

We imagined that we would be this interview team - and we worked out this whole “good cop, bad cop” deal that we thought would get everyone to reveal themselves to us. But our first interview at the USC paper was with Matt Dillon, and Toby had been obsessed with him when he was in the Outsiders and had this poster of him from Rumble Fish that she wanted him to sign. So we go to interview him, and she’s supposed to be the bad cop, but she starts good copping, and I really suck as the bad cop, but , evidently she can’t flirt as the bad cop - Wes is enjoying his own story, but sees that he should bring himself back to the question. WES (CONT’D) Anyway, yes. I can do interviews.
And how did you and Toby break down the writing duties in your partnership? Who exactly did what?

You know, also very funny. Because we get asked that question all the time, and Toby would always field it. Oh man, what exactly did she say? She has this really funny metaphor that she always used - Wes is trying desperately to remember, and taking way too long to do so. He locks at Daniel, and realizes this interview is going south - fast. WES (CONT’D) Well - enough about Toby. We're not here to interview Toby. We’re here to interview me. He looks at his nametag. WES (CONT‘D) Dave. : Daniel cracks a smile. Wes takes a deep breath and tries to move on.  1/9/03 . 45.

Catter, dressed in a horrible polo shirt and hat that both say GOURMET COURIER, makes her way up Paul's long driveway with a huge WARMER BAG in her arms. She gets to the front door and just opens it and goes in.
Catter makes her way into the living room to find Paul, Rob and Mollie sitting on the couch. Paul is expertly wielding his remote control at the TV. Catter @rops the bag on the table and sits.
What's up?
Paul's TiVo only tapes him Will and Grace,
Se, your TiVo knows you're gay?
I think it’s profiling. Homo-profiling. My TiVo homo~files me. ‘Catter reaches into the warmer bag, pulls out some cartons of food and lays them out on the coffee table.

Pizza with gorgonzola, pounded chicken, penne arrabiatta. Oh, and you guys bought me fusili with pancetta and cream sauce - Catter takes her carton, and plops onto the couch. Paul looks at her WARMER BAG still sitting on the floor.
Don’t you have other food in that thing that needs to be delivered?
Yeah. They can waic. Catter heads into the kitchen.
So, who's drinking what?  1/9/03 46.

Paul follows Catter into the Kitchen. She grabs some glasses out of the cupboard, and turns around to find herself face to face with Paul. He looks her in the eyes. She looks away. He keeps looking at her, but her eyes remain glued to the floor.
No. You didn’t. Catter just stands there, holding two glasses, eyes on the ground. PAUL (CONT’D} Catter, please tell me you didn’t.
(very softly) I did. It was just a kiss. I just - Paul turns away from her. He is clearly PISSED.

Do you have any respect at all for the little group we have established here? I mean, I know you do the count back, and think you’re going to be single forever, and continue to date wildly inappropriate men who will never marry you - but you cannot take those frustrations out on your friends. We cannot go around kissing each other’s fiancees. I’m not sure about the you, but I don’t have any other friends. So, I'd appreciate it if you didn’t fuck this up. Catter looks like she’s going to cry. Paul is unmoved.
I shouldn’t have done it.
Brilliant analysis. Tears spill from Catter’s eyes.

(softly) I‘m sorry.  1/9/03 . 47. The tears continue to flow, as Catter runs out of the kitchen, INT. PAUL’S HOUSE- LIVING ROOM - SAME Catter tears through the living room, grabs her warmer bag, and runs out the door. Rob and Mollie watch her - stunned. Paul emerges from the kitchen, expertly carrying three glasses of wine.
What the hell? Paul passes out the wine.
I’1l just have a soda or -
Trust me, in a moment, you’1l want the wine. Or Vicadin. Rob and Mollie look at Paul, their interest definitely piqued.

.CLOSE ON JOHN'S FACE - as he strides through a group of people with MELISSA (THE HOOKER) on his arm. He can barely contain his pride. under this we hear: TOBY (V.0.) . So, our advice to you, John, is - start acting like a boyfriend. Take her out on real dates, introduce her to your friends- We go FULL SCREEN TO:
A COCKTAIL PARTY, of well dressed folks in their twenties and thirties, is well underway. John and Melissa make their way through the party.
- try to sleep with her best friend - you know, boyfriend stuff. PETE, late 30's, approaches John and Melissa.
Pete! I didn’t know you were going to be here.  1/9/03 ag.
Yeah, I’m back in LA to stay this time.
Really? We should get together, play tennis or something.
Definitely. A beat. Pete looks awkwardly at Melissa. Melissa just looks at John. John realizes his faux-pas.
Oh my god, I'm sorry. Sweetie, I’m so sorry. Pete, this is Melissa.
Nice to meet you.
It’s really nice to meet you, too, Pete. An awkward pause. - MELISSA (CONT’D) Well, I’m gonna hit the little girl’s room.
OK. I/’11 be here. Melissa leaves. John turns to Pete.

Wow. Where’d you find her? John smiles. WITH MELISSA ~- As she winds her way back to the bathroom As she goes, she takes in the whole party. Well dressed people laughing, smoking, drinking - clearly with money to burn. She’s feeling a bit out of place. She gets to the bathroom - there are a few girls waiting by the door. She decides not to wait and turns around. She works her way back to John, and as she nears, she can overhear the conversation he’s having with Pete.
No shit.
I know.. It’s really unbelievable. She's - amazing.

Wow. I didn’t know you could make that transition. John just shrugs. Pete takes a swig of his drink. PETE (CONT’D) She doesn’t look like a hooker. . John turns and sees Melissa standing there - she heard that last remark. She's not happy. She quickly makes her way out of the party. John follows.
Toby sits, sipping a martini with Craig, the cute guy from the deli.
So, are those letters for real? Or do you guys write them yourselves?
No, they are totally real.
So, do you have to read through hundreds cf them to find the good ones?

Well, I usually let Wes do that. There is a tiny uncomfortable silence, but Toby presses on. TOBY (CONT’D) I used to read through the letters with him, but it started making me so sad about - like ~ the human condition, you know. I mean, what has transpired in these poor peoples’ lives that they want to marry their hookers or have three ways with their UPS and FEDEX guys, you know?
You don’t find those things a little funny?  1/9/03 50.

A little. But after a while, it would just make me profoundly sad. So, Wes started reading all the mail, and just giving me a few choice letters. He would wade through all the sad stories for me, so I wouldn't have to get so down. “Toby seems struck by what she just said. It's like she has just started to realize what she’s done.
He sounds like a great partner to have. Toby considers this and nods.
Yeah. Then, a waitress approaches, placing an ENORMOUS PLATE OF RIBS in front of the man sitting next to Toby at the bar.
Wow. Those are some nice looking stripes.
Eommm?

Stripes. We call them stripes because - you know - ribs - it’s so body-part- specific. Like ordering toes or femurs or something, you know? Toby laughs at her own observation. Craig doesn’t get it. Another moment of uncomfortable silence. TOBY (CONT’D) You know what? Thank you so much for the drink, and this is about to be the rudest thing I’ve ever done - well, not the rudest because I did just cali off a wedding and all - but I think I better just - go. Toby gets up, pulis out some cash and leaves it on the bar. TOBY (CONT’D) See ya at the deli. Number three no onion.  1/9/03 51. Toby doesn’t even wait for a reply before she’s out the door. .
Mollie and Rob, along with the rest of the class, are all suited up. Rob looks a little freaked.

So, Wes and Toby - you're up. Mollie gets up and walks toward the pool. Rob doesn’t move. MITCH (CONT’D) Wes, you ready for this? Rob, clearly forgetting his name is Wes, looks off absently and doesn’t respond at all. MITCH (CONT’D} Wes?
Right. Me. Wes. I’m Wes. And ready. Mitch looks at him oddly.

Now remember, you are practicing using your “buddy air.* You and Toby are going to go down, she is going to take out her own air supply - which will be pretty scary at first - but then you are going to give her your buddy air, which feeds off of your tank - and the two of you will ascend together.
Yep. Got it. Wes. I’m Wes. Rob and Mollie start to get into the pool. Mollie gives Rob a disapproving look.

You know, it’s actually a perfect exercise for newlyweds. When one cf you loses their own air, the other can share their air, and vice versa. Ycu should do great. Rob looks nervous as he gingerly slips into the water. Mollie smiles and goes under, too.  1/9/03 . 52.

head_text.subj: UNDER WATER IN THE JEWISH COMMUNITY CENTER POOL

text: Mollie, smiling and giving Rob the thumbs up, takes out her air supply - she is now HOLDING HER BREATH. She swims over to Rob. Rob is breathing from his tank, but looks TOTALLY PANICKED. Moliie motions for Rob to give her his buddy ‘air. Rob just looks at her, panicked. She’motions again and then - with no warning - ROB LEAVES HER THERE AND SWIMS TO THE SURFACE.
Rob breaks: the surface, taking out his breathing apparatus and gasping for air, dramatically. He spazzes . over to the side.
Oh man. Man that was - crazy. The whole class is looking at him - where’s his new wife? Mollie finally breaks the surface, really gasping for air.
What happened?
Dude - you get down there and it's like - who knows? Even Rob doesn’t seem convinced by this story.
I teok out my air supply and motioned for Wes to give me his buddy air, but he panicked.
You realize, of course, if we had been on an ocean dive; you would have just killed your new bride. Mollie shoots daggers at Rob. Rob tries to lighten the mood.

So, in terms of it being a good exercise for newlyweds, how’d we do? Mollie walks away, leaving Rob alone on the side of the  ’ 1/9/03 53. EXT. WES‘ (& TOBY'S) APARTMENT - NIGHT Wes sits on the balcony, smoking and staring into space. GIRL’S VOICE Hey. Smokey. Wes looks down onto the sidewalk, where Catter stands, in her Gourmet Courier shirt, looking tired.
Can I come up?
I’m scared of you.
I won’t touch. I promise.
Yeah. Come on up. Wes waits. Catter emerges onto the balcony with. two ‘ beers, handing one to Wes. She takes a seat next to him Wes takes an awkward drag off of his cigarette.
So, smoking is part of the *New Wes”, I’m guessing?
Yep.
Looks pretty dumb. WES . Still working out the kinks. Catter summons her courage and turns to Wes.
Wes, I need you to know that I’m incredibly sorry about what happened the other night. I don’t know what's wrong with me.
Clearly, I’m irresistible .

Yeah, something like that.  1/9/03 . 54. They sit in silence for a moment. CATTER (CONT‘D) OK, maybe I do know what's wrong with me. I’m ingane. I rented Notting Hill recently, and I had to turn it off because I was jealous. Jealous of the love of two FICTIONAL CHARACTERS, Wes. I watch A Wedding Story on the Learning Channel religiously, and get constantly incensed that all of these freaks have found the perfect other freak -- and I , haven't. I just want to find someone already so I can stop obsessively tweezing my eyebrows and fake laughing and just relax. I shouldn't have kissed you, but I was full of rum and possibilities - and I'll just freak if Toby finds out - Wes smiles.
Your secret is safe with me.
Thank you. Awesome. Moving on. Let’s talk about you. Wes nods as he flicks his ashes into the ashtray.
Did you see that flick? That was a nice, natural flick.
It was a nice flick. Catter looks at Wes. CATTER (CONT’D) Anything else on your mind, perhaps? Wes looks back at her, all seriousness.
{his voice a little shaky) I don’t know how I’m going to make it alone, Catter. Catter is clearly moved by his admission.  1/9/03 . 55.
Wes, I know this is incredibly hard for you. It’s hard for all of us. We all love both of you. We all feel like we're losing something. And we don’t want to have to choose between you -
You don’t have to choose. Toby and I - Catter puts her hand on Wes’ hand and squeezes.
I choose you. Wes looks at her, unsure how to respond. INT. TOBY’S CAR - NIGHT Toby, straight from her ill-fated date, is on the cel phone.
(into phone) Kip, it’s me. Your sister. Pick up. Nothing.
Seriously, it’s an emergency. Pick up. Nothing.
I met this girl I want to fix you up with- A MAD CLAMORING THROUGH THE PHONE, as Kip picks up.
Yeah?
What if I‘m still in love with him?
Mom just sent me home with eight thousand chicken breasts.
I’m serious, Kip. What if I never connect with anyone the way I connect with him?  1/3/03 56. They are both speechless.
Tell me what I should do.
I have no idea. I’ve never had a successful relationship.
Then tell me what Wes and I would tell me to do. Kip thinks about it.
Talk to him, Toby is silent. KIP (CONT’D) dust talk to him. I’ve never seen two people who can talk about everything or nothing like you guys can. A smile starts to grow on Toby’s face.
Thanks Kip.

Anytime. Toby hangs up the phone and keeps driving. EXT. WES’ (& TOBY’S) APARTMENT - SAME Toby pulls up to her old apartment. Just as she is about to get out of the car, she looks up and, through the windshield, she sees Catter and Wes on the balcony. She studies the image closer - Catter is looking meaningfully at Wes, her hand on his. Toby looks - devastated. She lets her gaze linger on them for a final moment, and then hastily pulls away. FADE OUT.
AcT_Iv INT. CATTER’S HYUNDAI - DAY Catter, in her Gourmet Courier t-shirt, jerkily drives the stick shift. Toby rides shot gun, with a big warmer- bag full of food on her lap.
We haven’t done this in so long -
{no love) Yeah. .
Remember that time you were delivering with me, and we delivered to Dean Cain and we just stayed there and ate all of those spring rolls that we just delivered and -
(still no feeling) Yeah. That was fun. Catter looks at Toby, nervous.
Is something wrong? I mean, of course something's wrong, you just called off your wedding - but I mean -

Tell me why - if you are my best friend - I drive over to find you hanging out with Wes on his balcony last night.  . 1/9/03 58.

Yes.

I don't know, Catter. But in this case, yes. This is a really weird time for me, and I need your support as my friend. Catter looks at Toby, and in one non-graceful move, inspiring a few honks, pulls over to the curb and james the car into park.
OK, here’s the thing, Toby. And I know this sucks to hear, because it really sucks to say, but I gotta be honest. I think you're making a huge mistake.

Wes is a great guy. And the life that you guys have built for yourselves, people dream about that shit. I can't | understand why you would just - chuck it.
I shouldn‘t have to defend myself to you. It just didn’t feel right, Catter. That should be enough. It just didn’t feel right.
* Are you're still sure it isn’t right? Toby considers this. Although we see a little doubt starting to creep in, her answer is:

Yes. I’m sure. I'm pretty sure. Though neither Catter or Toby seem totally convinced. INT. WES’ APARTMENT - AFTERNOON Wes sits on his couch, alone. He’s deep in thought. He’s listening to the long opening to “At Dawn” by My Morning Jacket. As the song kicks in, everything seems to SLOW DOWN and he hears faint voices. He’ turns and sees a YOUNGER WES and TOBY, sort of ghostlike, as if they’re PROJECTED ON THE WALL, struggling to carry a futon up the stairs. Toby, going backwards, is very serious as she keeps falling. Younger Wes can‘t stop laughing. IN THE BATHROOM - Wes peers in, where he sees Toby, standing behind younger Wes, dying his hair. SLIM, now just a little kitten, runs around on the sink, getting dye all over himself.  1/9/03 . 60. IN THE BEDROOM - Wes walks up the stairs goes in, where all around him Younger Wes, with a windbreaker pulled tight over his head, tries unsuccessfully to shoo a bird out of the window. Toby hides in the closet and intermittently looks out at the proceedings. The bird awoops all around the room, narrowly missing the ceiling fan and Wes’ head. -IN THE LIVING ROOM - Wes. then plops back down onto the right side of the couch. Younger Toby and Wes sit, cuddied up, on the left side of the couch. Older Wes sits back and closes his eyes tightly. Slowly, the song fades out, as do the images of Young Toby and Wes.° Then it’s silent. Wes opens his eyes, and he seems - OK. THE PHONE RINGS. Wes goes to pick it up.
Hello. Yes, Daniel, of course, from Interview. A beat.

Wow - I'm surprised. I mean, and thrilled. You have the authority to do that, right, just offer me the job? Right, of course you do. Wow. Wow. Wes looks around, and takes a deep breath. INT. Melissa, we’ve known each other for five years. And I’ve met a lot of women in those five years. But I have always held each of them up to this imaginary standard of beauty and wit and grace -- and not one of them has been able to measure up. And then one day I realized - that standard was not imaginary. That standard was you. I love you. And no one, no matter what she does for a ~ living, could ever compare. Me. Me - did I fuck it up? . Wes looks at her for a very long time.
No. I don’t think you did. This is not the answer that Toby was expecting.

Tob, I've spent the last few days alone in this house. And every spoon or printer or doorknob has a story - we have like years of memories packed into every square inch. Melissa lays in bed, peacefully asleep. We find John, dressed, straightening his tie by the foot of the bed. He moves over to Melissa, kisses her on the forehead. He then pulls out an ENVELOPE from his jacket pocket and places it on the nightstand. He looks at her one last time and ieaves. As he shuts the door, Melissa stirs. She turns over to find John gone and the envelope on the nightstand. Her peacefulness is quickly overtaken by sadness. She slowly reaches over and takes the envelope.  1/9/03 . 67. She opens it warily, and pulls out a VELVET POUCH. Curious, she reaches in and pulls out a HUGE ENGAGEMENT RING. She grasps it tightly, relieved and ecstatic.
